p: In the present study, 100 medicinal plants which have been included in TCM prescriptions for antiviral treatment were selected and prefractionated into 5 fractions each. The library consisting of 500 prefractionated TCM extracts was subsequently subjected to a phenotypic screening for anti-influenza actives [ 11, 12]. As a result, ten TCM fractions were identified to have antiviral potency against IAV, deserving further analysis for novel anti-influenza lead drugs.
